metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5350 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
epan/dissectors/packet-dcerpc-spoolss.c in the SPOOLS component in Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.12 and 2.x before 2.0.4 mishandles unexpected offsets, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a crafted packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5350` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
libwireshark8 - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
libwiretap6 - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
libwscodecs1 - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
libwsutil7 - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
tshark - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
wireshark - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
wireshark-common - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
wireshark-gtk - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
wireshark-qt - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04').
